review: During my last visit I ordered the 2 for $10 special and chose the Parmesan Crusted Chicken and the pot stickers. The pot stickers were fantastic but when my entree came out the plastic solo cup with the sauce had melted into the food and everything looked like it had been sitting under the heat lamp for 20 minutes. I will give them credit for taking care of the problem and making it right but I was disappointed.

Dear terrible bartender, Thank you for being so unfriendly. If you had been even a little helpful, I may have waited to get my food order taken. If I had gotten my food order taken, I would have been forced to eat your terrible food. If I would have eaten your terrible food, I probably would not have had the awesome duck at the Thai restaurant down the street. You are awful and made the cute bartender and the nice, older bartender look bad. I hope they quit just to get away from your miserable face. Thank you for making me find the Thai restaurant. It made my 5 dollar diet coke well worth it.

Salmon was small and way over cooked.  Said it had mushrooms, had only 2 small slices of one. Fries were cold, broccoli bare with no butter or sauce. Menu was lacking. What happened to the old Fridays I used to like? So disappointing.

This is a review for the past three times we ate there with kids. Fast seating but LONG WAIT for food, long wait for check. Kids pasta was tough & couldn't cut it with steak knife & had to reorder! Still felt like it had been microwaved the 2nd time!! Parts of the Jack Daniel sampler was COLD(!) & another part warm!!! They offered to change & later took it off our check. But it happened twice. Otherwise, my husband enjoyed the Ahi Tuna & another time his hamburger. They are also polite & welcoming at entrance.

POOR MANAGEMENT! While I normally like Fridays restaurant, this one has bad management. The waitress messed up my order which I said was no big deal but I couldn't eat what was given to me. I then still had to pay for their mess up with a 10% discount for my trouble. I couldn't believe I had to pay for a meal I didn't want or EAT! I will never go back there again!
Service has gone down hill. I would avoid here. The drinks are not great. Food is ok.

I visited this location and arrived around 2 pm. I was taken to my booth with my girlfriend and ordered around 2:15. I purchased a soup/salad & my girlfriend ordered a half deli sandwich & soup. 20 minutes later after seeing burgers, steaks, and pastas come out (to people who ordered after us) I asked my waitress where my order was. It came out a few minutes later wrong. My poor excuse for a salad came with no dressing, our soups had film on top from sitting out, & my girlfriends sandwich was poorly made.

The problem is, When I go here the food absolutely sucks and I swear I'll never go back, but then I forget how bad it is and after a year or so I stop back in , THEN I remember why it is I haven't been here in so long. Service is up to par ,but the food is just awful. Hopefully I'll read my own review before I decide to return.

We had a great meal, black bean burger and flatbread app. Best of all because we were splitting the burger our extremely friendly and helpful server Allison brought it to us already split. Thanks Allison!

My boyfriend and I were in the middle of a huge move, and when we stopped at the Milford Target for the usual move-specific needs (i.e. new plunger), we realized we hadn't eaten all day. Although we wanted to get take-out and go home, we were too tired to lift Styrofoam boxes, so we decided to eat in at TGI Friday's, the only non-drive-thru "restaurant" we could find in the immediate area.  I had fond memories of eating at TGI Friday's (at the Solomon Pond Mall) while I was in high school. Hanging out, milking the free soda refills and splurging on fried mozzarella sticks. My boyfriend had never been to one, so I thought it was a good enough reason to stop at Friday's and get a burger.  I was very surprised to see that gone was the "flare" and the striped uniforms and the bright colors of the TGI Friday's of my memory. The Friday's of today have a more sophisticated neutral atmosphere, with modern styling. They are comfortable, though a little less charming, but that may be nostalgia speaking.  The place was dead. This was a Friday night, so you'd think for this area, it would be a busy go-to restaurant for teens or families. We were seated right away, and I ordered the special sangria and a glass of water. My boyfriend had a coke. We got our drinks, minus the water, which I asked for again when we put in our appetizer, and again when we ordered our entrees... Finally, after I got my meal, I got my glass of water.  My boyfriend had one of those stacked Philly burgers. It's not a cheese-steak burger, it's a burger with lots of stuff on it. He was very happy with it. I Had the 6oz steak, with mashed potatoes and the tomato mozzarella salad. My steak and mashed potatoes were delicious. The salad was not great - lots of tomatoes and only a few little bits of mozzarella - and was really cold, not fresh cold, frozen cold. My sangria was ok, very very sweet, and not worth the mind-blowing $11 price tag.  We had no room for dessert. The service was not great. Our waitress kept telling us they were really backed up and it was an unusually busy night, but the restaurant was not even half full.  I was surprised at the huge gap between the quality of the service and the quality of the food. Though my salad was meh, my steak was cooked perfectly and the mashed potatoes were really yummy. Had I checked this location's Yelp rating before going in, I would never have gone. And though I likely won't go again, seeing as I just moved out of the area, the food was ok, and I wasn't looking for a great restaurant experience, I was looking for food.

Sat at the bar... No service for a good 15 min when it was very slow 8 ppl at bar (Sunday night). I've never had soup here so I wanted to try it.  There was just a piece of hard plastic in my soup for $7.... Chunks of broccoli with fake cheese. There's like no point in going to a restaurant to pay for fake food. Everything this restaurant cooks is frozen or pre-made beforehand. Bartender and manager took my soup off of my bill but I'm still not satisfied. TGIF used to be so good. I'm so disappointed. I'm not usually this picky and I don't like to complain, but I can't eat plastic... So, I ordered a salad... It was okay cuz I was hungry. Burnt microwaved bacon in my salad. Gross! TGIF is going to go down hill don't you think? And it made it awkward between me and the friendly bartender who likes me. When the bartender took soup off, wasn't the manager supposed to come out to apologise? Isn't that what restaurants are supposed to do?! They didn't. He just gave the 'A OK' to take it off my bill. Not impressed.  While I'm already on a roll, let me make another complaint. My wine glass was dirty; sticky! And where I was sitting, it wasn't cleaned up. Food all over the counter.  I never ever complain but that's so gross and this has been the worst experience I've ever had at a TGIF!! The bartender went around the corner and I left without a goodbye.

My server asked me if I wanted change instead of just getting my change and letting me decide to tip her quietly if I wanted to. Which I shouldn't have since she didn't provide me plasticwear for my to-go order. She wasn't particularly courteous to me considering how friendly she was to the people on either side of me. I would never come here if I weren't in the area.

Your standard TGI Fridays, but a bit cleaner and the staff is very nice.  From the girl at the door, the bartender and even the guy who delivered my food, I ate at the bar, everyone was aiming to please.  I was staying at the hotel nearby so a bit of a trapped customer, but the experience was very favorable.  The salmon and line slaw was better than I had anticipated.

Service is horrible, just awful. Couldn't be more dysfunctional place. As in bringing the wrong drink twice in a row, bringing me the wrong credit card ticket to sign AFTER giving me the correct one initially. Sitting down at the bar where 3/4 of place is empty to see multiple bar tenders and a manager ignore me for several minutes. Oh and they weren't actually working, gossiping. Straight up bad.

I am pretty easy to please and I take a restaurant for what it is. TGI Fridays isn't The Capital Grill nor should you expect it to be.  I had not been to a Fridays in almost 10 years and my last experience wasn't a good one. When my wife suggested we go to one I wasn't thrilled. When we walked in it didn't look like the Fridays I remembered. It was a new, better decor. There wasn't that corny bric-a-brac on the walls they use to have. So tacky! The place looked spotless and it was crowded. However, we got a table in less than 5 minutes!  The waitress Shari came over quickly to take our drink order and tell us about the specials. Our drinks arrived in a minute or 2 and we ordered our meal with help from Shari. Shari was very helpful, polite with an outstanding  customer service attitude!  My wife's salad arrived but had some cheese on it and she hates that. She will eat pizza or grilled cheese sandwiches but not cheese on any salad. Crazy huh? But she is a great wife so I have that going for me.....which is nice.   Anyway, she brought it to Shari attention. Shari apologized profusely and offered to bring a new salad.  My wife told her to forget it and it was fine. A few moments later the Manager, Gene, came over and asked about the problem. My wife told him there wasn't a problem and thanked him for his concern.  We could tell he was interested in our satisfaction. In this day and age a business cares about its customers?? Amazing. On to the food; the appetizer was DELICIOUS! Boneless wings perfectly seasoned, crunchy and delicious! Our meals, both chicken (but prepared differently) salads, were AMAZING! I was shocked I was in a Fridays. The drinks are reasonably priced and generous. Not like some restaurants that put their drinks in a thimble and charge $15 a drink!   This is the Fridays I remember from the 90's!  Rating  Food = 10, service = 10, value = 10, atmosphere = 10, Manager = 10  Cheap date with my wife = Priceless!

Starving after a long day's work on Friday I decides to give Friday's a try.  For a Friday night the place was not busy so I sat at the bar and ordered a meal and a drink.   25 minutes later.  Drink empty. No food.  Every single person behind bar, including the manager ignored me.  I don't necessarily feel like a patron should inquire about their order.  So I decided to test them out.  I pushed my empty drink away.  Liked continually down at my watch. Cranes my neck to see if food was coming.  Eye contact with every staff member. Nothing.   My bartender was busy talking to his friends at the other end of the bar.   So I got up, walked over to the manager and informed him I was walking out without paying my tab. And I let him know why.  As he stood around the register with a gaggle of waiters and waitresses just staring at me like morons.   I will be in Milford quite often on business.  And I will never go back to Fridays.  In fact. I won't go to any Fridays.   PS Acapulco Mexican restaurant down the street is awesome.  Great food and the nicest wait staff.  Lesson learned!!

Got in tonight,  place was empty, so we figured it would be an easy go. Hostess tells us that we have to wait because they are short staffed in the kitchen and that the kitchen staff would kill her if she sat us. Ordered appetizers,  green been fries, gave us nothing and they were burned too. Never coming to this one again. Oh and they got my girlfriends salad wrong. Really?

My wife and I had not been here for lunch in years so we decided to give it a try this past Saturday...HUGE MISTAKE!  I now remember why we haven't been back in a long time, the service stinks!  There were only a handful of tables filled and it took a good 10 minutes before someone came by to take our drink order and another 10 minutes before our food order was taken.  We noticed that all the staff were just standing around in groups chatting, completely ignoring our glances.  Once our food was up and ready to be brought to the table, which we could plainly see because of the open kitchen,  we noticed that there was a staff meeting going on and our food was just sitting under the heat lamps for a good 5 minutes.  We also noticed during our stay another table get up and leave because no one ever came by to wait on them.  Oh, and I received the wrong burger, but I was so hungry I just ate it because I couldn't stand the thought of waiting any longer.  I was a waiter in my college years and am quite sympathetic and understanding that things can happen that are beyond the control of the waiter, but this place is just ridiculously horrible with their service training.

I would not recommend this place to anyone. I received the worst service of my life at this restaurant. I went here with my boyfriend on New Year's Eve. The food was average and our waitress was good...in the beginning. We paid our bill and left a tip, my boyfriend went out to warm the car up and I waited at our table. While I was waiting, the waitress came over to get her tip, and then proceeded to return to the table about 2 minutes later. The first thing she said was "Was my service bad or something?" I was shocked she was even approaching me and replied saying "no." She continued on to say that I gave her a 2% tip (which I did not), and showed me how you are supposed to give a tip, and told me how you are supposed to give a 20% tip. But it gets worse! I had no idea how to respond and said "okay well that's my boyfriend..I don't know" and she said, "Well you might want to teach your boyfriend how to tip" How disrespectful can someone get?!?! I could not believe as a loyal customer to this restaurant I was treated that way. It is truly disgusting. I also do not feel that management handled the situation properly. Nothing was done to the waitress and I did not receive anything, not even an apology. I would recommend staying away from this place and their rude, disrespectful staff.

Awesome place with very friendly staff:). It's a very comfortable and affordable place. I went out for an early valentines date with the boyfriend and we had a great time :) we look forward to our next visit!

Hello, just give me  30 seconds.. I was on a plane from SFO to Boston "I don't eat crap in a box airplane food" my flight ended me up some where called Milford, Maine . I was dumped off at a holiday Inn  express....needing food was very hard on my soul. They told me in walking distance was chain food store TGIF ..Thinking like anyone with with a bowling score over 170..no way...yet I went. Food was good it worked. but The service was fantastic....and its all due to  the nice person called Amanda.. Thanks for making it real .
Food was awful, lettuce was white instead of green. Burger was like a hockey puck, fries were soggy and service was super slow. Avoid this place if you can help it.

The servers are nice. Yet whenever I order BBQ wings they always come back buffalo. Not a big deal but annoying when it happens every single time. Usually takes too long for food. If my parents weren't paying the bill here I wouldn't go back.

The waitress was awesome. Beyond that though, the best thing I can say about the place is there is ample parking.  That's not to say the place is bad. It's just not good. The food is somewhat bland and the drinks are overpriced.

I have mixed feelings about tgi Fridays. Either it's alright or it's really bad... Let me elaborate. If you happen to be in the area and you're looking to get drinks with friends it works but if you're looking for a good meal with that someone special I probably wouldn't go here. The atmosphere is bro-ish. Lots of creepy men or just under aged humans going out in a very loud way. I'll occasionally stop by if I have a wing craving during weekdays never weekends. I'm in and I'm out. The service isn't bad but it's nothing noteworthy. One time I went there with a girlfriend and they decided to add the tip onto our 20 dollar bill automatically.. I thought it was sleazy.
We have always had good service here. The staff is friendly and the food is good for a chain restaurant. The burgers are always very good. Prices are right. No complaints.
The manager deserves to be fired. This place is is way under staffed, and the staff they have is under trained.

I LOVE this TGI Fridays. It's just the best of the best.  It's SO much better than all of the other ones...... like SO much better. They have higher standards and in general, just better customer service.  They allow more than one coupon, the restaurant is renovated, and Julia, one of the waitresses is SO friendly, kind, funny, and just the BEST. I always look forward to coming here over other locations (Mansfield especially). The food is great, and everything is always consistent and accurate. The rewards program is just outstanding and effects in coupons and offers for free things on a weekly basis. And above all, this TGI Fridays has been recently undergone a complete makeover into "Friday's". Super clean, well kept and they run a tight and organized ship! Management is friendly and whenever I call them it's always for a compliment; whenever calling the Mansfield location it's always a complaint.  Highly suggested. 5 stars.  I also HIGHLY SUGGEST joining the stripes program. For every $1 spent you get one stripe point. You can earn free burgers, desserts, coupons, and other stuff. Also, DO NOT throw out your receipt, and MAKE SURE to remember to take it. There is a survey for a free dessert / appetizer (up to $8), and if you buy a burger there is a JumpBurger code, go online to  , type in your code and send the free burger to your friends or someone else. Always, great savings!
Took us 30 minutes to even get out waters on a Wednesday midday when it's not even busy. I told the hostess and she said she would get a waitress which took 10 more minutes.

Went there again last week with wife and kid. For a monday night they take forever in that kitchen to fill in the orders i shit you not. The appetizers were boneless wings (boring tastes like chicken fingers), mozzarela sticks (you can have better from burguer king`s drive-through) and a fried pork dumpling (it woldtaste perfect if instead of pan frying the damn thing??? they had deep fried it..). But im only updating this because of the main courses. I had a steak, asked for medium rare got it medium well. the rice and mash taht came with it were good though). My wife had a parmesan crusted chicken with tomato salad. The salad was nasty, old tomatoes and 5 little pieces of mozzarela dont make a salad, and her chicken is the very reason why im updating this: it was the nastiest piece of chicken ive ever had in my entire life. It wasn`t undercooked or anything like that but the taste tho.. It wasnt parmesan and the chiken tasted like they took it out of the freezer, left it out for 24 hours, put it back in, and then deforsted it to make that nasty crap. First update i ever make on yelp. Want a suggestion? If youre going here, try ONLY the appetizersm you wont regret. :)

Unbelievably bad. Used to be,one of the best but it's now just plain old rotten. Went there on Sunday afternoon and sat at the bar. Took a long,time to get an order for beer in, the bartender told us at least 3 times how busy it was...But it was not. The draft beer, bud light was flat with nasty undertaste if.i could have gotten her attention i would have told her.   Finally my date and I ordered their build a burger, which sounds like a good idea.....the French fries were cold, ok get the "busy" bartenders attention..then I get to  the medium burger..burnt,.black bacon, burnt black . burger. both.were sent back. New ones come out better but dry and greasy.  Do not know how this is possible. Rolls were also dry and stale.. (fozen?)  The bud beer tasted awful so we ordered yuengling also.same rotten under taste.    Finally I get the manager. She comps us the burgers and proceeds to tell us "I tried one for lunch.and it was awful" what? "They changed vendors for the burgers "   just unfuckingbelieveable...

I have to say, TGI Fridays has not always been my "go-to" restaurant, but I always keep my hopes up. This time my hopes were too high. When I first walked in, I got that great aroma of delicious food! They had great music, and the Celtics on every TV! The decor was great, (like always), with the outstanding paintings and beautiful wall design! The waiters were very nice, and not so short staffed (great for me!). But, our waiter took about 20-25 minutes just to take our drink orders. I had Dr. Pepper, which was very warm for some reason. When the server came over to take our food order, I told him the Baby Back Ribs. Since I'm allergic to eggs, milk, and nuts, I asked the waiter to check for any of those in the sauce. He brought back an allergen menu (menu explaining types of allergies in the food) and told me they were out of ribs. So, I ordered a house salad with oil and vinegar dressing. He told me that he would make sure that there were no crossovers with any of my allergies. Again, it took WAY too long for a salad. 30 minutes?! Are you kidding me?! I eventually got my meal only to find it containing not just croutons (which had milk), but BOTH mozzarella and cheddar cheese, right in the middle!! I flagged the waiter down and told him they put cheese on it. He took it back and had a new salad made for me. I got the second salad, and it still had croutons, which I gave to my brother. The overall meal was "ehh". The grilled chicken on top was good, but it had a little too much fat, giving it a rubbery texture. The iceberg lettuce was very crisp and cold (the way I like it!). When I got the check, I was expecting my salad to be free, because of the mix-up with the cheese. Nope. FULL COST. Also, the waiter never had the manager or the cook come to my table and give a polite, sincere apology! To get back at them, I left no tip. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who loves being screwed over. One things for certain, I will NEVER go to TGI Fridays ever again.

Food is cheap portions and beer was cold. But I wouldn't tell anyone to go there. Service was good Manager had an attitude for no reason to us And we had a party of 18 Should have made her happy But I guess not
Horrible service. Wasnt even busy. Management didnt seem to care left waitresses appologizing left and right.  Wont be back

I wish I had read the yelp reviews before going. The whole night was a disaster. Everything right down to the drinks came out wrong, food was sent 2-3 times. We were a table of 6, we ordered drinks, all wrong she brings margaritas we ordered love going island ice teas...we should have left then, but didn't. All the apps came out cold, then the burgers lol all wrong! Then the bill all wrong. The manager came over 2x never took any money off the bill just said she was sorry. 2 hrs for drinks apps and burgers. Trust me what I ate was not good. Save your time and money!!!! We will never go back

Can I give zero stars? This is the worst experience I have ever had! We spoke to the manger (Mellisa) 3 times. An yet our bill had not one thing taken off of. We asked our waitress Megan to fix our order many time. Dinners, drinks, apps, all messed up. Yet she couldn't get out her handy dandy note pad an pen to write down the screw ups she did. Sometimes it's the cooks or bartenders. But she was 100% set on saying we order this. When the whole table knew that was the case an she had just messed up again.  I will never return to the Milford tgif And because the manger couldn't do anything but talk about her personal life I will never return to any of there establishment. Please end the horrific experience of all an turn this into something better! It is a disgrace for a restaurant in Milford. Top it off  -drinks were horrible -atmosphere was terrible -space to move around was awful (not even crowded) -no syrup left for any of our sodas but still served. She acted like she knew but still served our drinks (which we were charged for btw) Sunday June 26 at7:30pm  Server: 416 Megan

Disgusting.     The atmosphere really sucks......high, dark ceilings, cement floors, tin can music blaring, loud, seats so low that my boobs were literally under the table top. Our waitress brought us the wrong drinks.   How hard is it to mess up a tea order?    Ditzy and not at all interested in doing a good job.   Ordered pretzels with beer flavored cheese....horrible!!!  Pretzels were bread logs which were black on the outside, gooey inside and covered with an outrageous amount of salt crystals.   Beer cheese dip was canned something???? We had the Cobb salad with chicken......horrible!!!!   Chicken was not cooked at all which is very unsafe.   Tomatoes were rotten, the tiny sliver or avocado was black.....honestly,  this was one of the worst meals we have ever been served.   The waitress came to our table and asked if the chicken was uncooked.....as sure sign that she has had this same issue before. I am astounded that the board of health hasn't shut this place down. I will NEVER go to another Friday's again.    Cooking food is the only thing they have to do and they can't even get that right.

As TGIFridays experiences go, ours was pretty good.  The staff was friendly and professional, the restaurant was dark and cold on a warm summer afternoon.  The food is prefab, sure, but our kids loved the burgers and the Jack Daniels Chicken was actually okay. This place was not hard to get a table at on a recent Saturday early evening.

If you're looking for a place to eat, don't stop here. Wife and I both working late.  We both ordered a chicken dish. Neither one of us could even finish it. We got it to go. My wife picked up dinner and could barely communicate with the bar staff over the crazy loud music. These guys should set up shop in the state university. Oh, the food. It was horrible.  No, almost inedible. Saved the left overs for our dog. There are several options in the area. Any one a better choice. Blah!!

I don't know what they have changed here, but I will not be back!!  I got my usual bruschetta chicken pasta.  It used to be angel hair with grilled chicken, diced tomatoes and a drizzle of balsamic.  This time it was fettuccini with what tasted like cheap jarred sauce and half a bottle of balsamic.  It was completely gross, couldn't even eat it.  The waitress was good about it and the manager took it off the bill.  I have heard nothing but bad things lately!!

I don't know what happened to this place, but it is the worst. We used to love coming here, but not anymore. The food is so gross. Seems like everything is frozen and microwaved. I don't think anything is made fresh, or with any care. Stay away.

The food was good, the house Chardonnay was great, the bartenders however, not very attentive.  I waited a good 15 minutes while I watched a bartender wipe down bottles and check his phone before he asked me if I wanted a drink.  He brought me a drink and menu, then I waited an additional 10 minutes for the bartender tender tending the other side of the bar to take my food order.  I had one glass of wine when time allowing would have warranted three (I would have had three, if asked for a refill). For a chain, the food was good.  For service, it certainly can be improved.

So here's the deal. I'm not here to review the food. We don't go to places like TGIF because of the "amazing cuisine" or atmosphere. We go because the food is safe and consistently good. It's not going to set the world ablaze - you know what you're in for. Sometimes you want 5-star high end dining. Other times you want a quick gut-bomb. Then there's days where you just need a bit of fuel without destroying your stomach or your palette.  I'm happy to say, this TGIF delivered. I can also so the waiting staff delivered. They were very sweet and Johnny-on-the-Spot with drink refills. You're probably thinking, "so what's with the 1-star ya jerk?!" The 1-star is for the chefs/cooks/etc.  My co-worker and I have to be at a meeting a few minutes away by 12:00pm. We're looking for a place to eat and she's never been to a TGIF. I tell her, ya gotta go - that it's consistently good food. (If you can stomach places like Olive Garden, Applebees, Outback or Chili's, then this place is right on point.) She agrees so we pull in. It's 11am, we walk up and the doors are locked. No biggie, the hostess was apologetic and let us in. I mention that to illustrate we are the *only* customers. By 11:04am, we have our drinks served and order in - I have a grilled chicken breadth and my co-worker has some sorta quesadilla situation. We sit back, converse, discuss our meeting and make awkward glances at the bartender is belting out songs like she's Adele (read: she's not). We chuckle and go back to business. Waitress comes back and refills our drinks. All is right with the world.  As we're serenaded by Adele-lite, I notice the kitchen staff playing a bit of grab-ass I. The kitchen. It's 11:20 so I figure food should be close. 11:25 we get another refill and the waitress tells us the kitchen staff is almost done. I'm thinking, duh, it's been 21 minutes for a tortilla and chicken. 11:30 hits and Adele is still kickin' ass at the bar tossing bottles in the air Tom Cruise style ala Cocktail. There's still nobody else in restaurant ordering food or drinks but I can't hate on Adele for keeping her game tight.  11:35 and our waitress comes back out to tell us, "My kitchen staff is still catching up." I'm thinking, "On what - sleep?!" Like I mentioned, our waitress was on point. I felt bad. She was doing her best and getting completely effed by the kitchen staff. I can't imagine having to walk over to your customers in an empty restaurant and having to lie just to cover for your inept kitchen staff. I really felt for her.  11:45 and I see kitchen-grab-ass continuing. I also see the second customers of the day arrive. I want to warn them off, but I don't want the waiting staff to get gipped (or is it jipped?!) out of tips. 11:49 and our food finally arrives a full 45 minutes after order it. Now, we have a meeting at 12:00pm. We're from out of town and our next hotel is 4 hours away. I'm. It carrying chicken breast and quesadillas in our car for 4 hours *after* our meeting. We absorb what we can and Hoover it down - cramps be damned.  We pay, run out the door, and race to the meeting. I vow to write a crummy review as I was completely disappointed. My co-worker forgot the dang receipt so here I am on Yelp rather than doing the "performance review" from the receipt code.  You might be thinking, "Dude, you arrived at opening. Of course it took longer. They need to warm stuff up, thaw food out, etc." I get that - but if it takes 30 minutes to prep the kitchen, then either open at 11:30 or get to work at 10:30. To the manager of this TGIF, you need to get back there and crack some heads. If you have extra scratch, maybe some singing lessons for Adele-lite. Her heart is in it, her voice isn't. Anyway, I hope every else's visit is better than mine. I'm not that guy who wets out to write bad reviews. "But dude, you just did!" Well, I'm hoping it might do some good. That's all from me. I'm heading to Cracker Barrel. Enjoy your meal! EDIT - The food was on par as well as the service.  The kitchen staff were asleep at the wheel.  The manager has acknowledged so I've bumped it up to three stars.  If the kitchen staff were on the ball, it'd be 4 stars.

Really disappointed. I'm easy to please, not high maintenance at all, but this experience was so poor I am actually taking the time to write a review. We got here early on a Friday night. No wait, place was only about half full and got seated right away. So far so good.  My expectations for a Friday's are low. We just wanted a relatively quick, decent meal before getting back on the road. We waited nearly 20 minutes before anyone even made eye contact with us after being seated. Usually at least someone will come over and offer water or something. Jeez. So far, service stinks and I'm so hungry I'm about to get up and head to Wendy's instead. We get our menus (still no water ever offered after we've been sitting here ignored for nearly 30 minutes) and then have to wait another 15 min before she comes back to take our order. I can understand if it's slamming here but it's not. There are empty tables still and tables that have been vacated with old food sitting on them still for 10 minutes.  You can see when the rest of this review is going so no need to perseverate on the obvious. It took forever, wasn't worth it, and I'm terribly disappointed that our quick and easy meal turned into us basically chasing our waitstaff around to do her job. The food came out cold and one plate at a time. Food quality (aside from the temperature) was decent but not great. My burger was underdone and my fries were so salty I'm still thirsty 3 hrs and about a gallon of water later.  Also, the bathroom was gross and there was a big chunk of hair in the sink. Obviously, I will not be back. This was the first time I've been to a Fridays in about 5 years and I can safely say it will be at least another 5 before I go back. I'm only giving it 2 stars because our waitress was sweet and at least there weren't any board of health level concerns but overall, all I have to say is "Yuck."

I certainly will ALWAYS remember this visit......I arrived for the last few innings of World Series Game 7....yeahhhh Cubbies!!!  I mean u can't be too critical of Friday's....it's a national chain that is always clean, with good service.  The food is what you expect.  I enjoyed it very much...no rave, but it's Friday's for Pete sake.....my bartender was very attentive( it was quite slow)....I had a great time.  I like Fridays

I love the anything with the Jack Daniels glaze on it... but my most recent experience at the Milford TGIFridays was less than desirable.  The server was obviously overwhelmed by her 3 tables and seemed to keep forgetting about us.  It took about 40 minutes for our food to come out once we did place our order which took forever to order since we could never find our waitress.  Always a good meal here but the service isn't always the best, gotta get on your 'a game' Fridays!!

Scott was our waiter and after taking our drink order gave us a run down on the specials. We ordered the Jack Daniels sliders and bone-in wings. Both were delicious!  We are on a road trip from Texas and Scott was a delight to talk to and very helpful on recommending places to visit.   Great food, great service, great prices!

I am really sad to say this because I used to love coming here, but this location has gone so far downhill. Nobody came over to take our order, so after sitting for awhile, I had to go ask the hostess to send someone over. Meanwhile, all of the waitstaff are standing together chatting. Food wasn't cooked all the way and was cold. Our server was very nice, however. Just a generally disappointing experience.

Was here last night with my mom. Dirty table near the kitchen to look into. Wings were overcooked. Soup tasted old. Drinks were slow. We watched them cooking in the kitchen and saw that irders were sitting there for over ten minutes, as well as THEY WERENT CHANGING THEIR GLOVES ENOUGH. The people I was with including myself are in the food service industry and we make sure our staff stays up to code which this place was NOT. Waitresses with their hair down and over seated. Our waitress was extremely nice and attentive. Needs new management

I've done it!   It's taken me decades, but I think I've found the worst restaurant in the state.  Seriously, it's that bad.  Lets start with the service, the waitress was polite and very friendly, which makes up for the fact that she forgot most of what we asked for.  Drinks, menus, food, you name it, she forgot we asked for it.  And she spent most of her time socializing with the other waitresses and staff who weren't doing much either, as there were maybe 20 customers in the restaurant.    It took forever to get drinks, which were mostly ice anyway, and since there was about 4 oz of liquid in the drinks, most of the time our glasses were empty. The food took forever to come out, and as I said the place was dead, at 7pm on a weekend night, which should've been a clue of what was to come.     Lets move on to cleanliness, or lack thereof.  This place is disgustingly dirty, the floor, some sort of rubbery composite material(?) is so dirty; It's gross, it appears that's it's never been cleaned.  And the bathroom was disgusting too, the trash receptacle was overflowing with paper towels, and since there appeared to be more staff than customers that's unacceptable.  Lets move on to the food, and mind you I wasn't expecting much.  It sucked.  All of it, well maybe my sons chicken finger things were ok, but my dinner and my wife's were horrible. And why does it take so long to cook, most of the stuff is premade junk to begin with.  And what's with the highly visible big poster board in the kitchen showing what the different plates look like? Weird..... TGI Friday's, stay away.   Go somewhere else, even Applebee's is 100X better!

Chicken quesadillas had what appeared to be cheap tuna fish in it, tasted like tuna as well.  Disgusting.    Hamburger ordered medium could not have been more well done and dry.  I told the waitress, she grinned and said "oh gee sorry".  Yeah that made it all better.  Horrible food.  Horrible new menu.  Not going back.    Don't waste your time or money on this sub par restaurant

So I came here with my sister just looking to sit at the bar and have some drinks and maybe split a meal. I start by ordering the spinach flatbread as an appetizer. Comes out cold. Keep in mind it's a weekday and not busy. Decided to not order food after that. The only saving grace was the bartender who I believe may have overheard my comments on the food. He informed me I could sign up for a rewards system and receive $8 off the app( it only costs $9) It was quick and saved me the cash on cold food without making a scene. Overall food was bad but the young bartender John seemed to hold down the bar well and keep my time there as pleasurable as possible. 5 stars for that particular bartender and 0 stars on the food I was served.
This restaurant has so much potential, too bad half of the waitresses are lazy. They like to chit chat in the back while our food just sits waiting to be delivered to our table.

Friday rarely disappoints. This Friday's, on this Friday, will forever go down as eternal legend. The food was terrific, and the value was other-worldly. Endless potato skins, potstickers, fried pickles, chicken wings (3 separate orders), meatballs, and reasonably priced adult beverages were flowing faster than the mighty Mississippi. This night, and these bartenders, made all other nights fade into quick and disappointing darkness. As the kiddos would say, "This night was lit." Whether it was helping old friends rekindle a dormant love or a weary business traveler unwind with a friendly wager on a college basketball game, I left saying 'Thank the heavens, that in here, it's always Friday."

The servers are over worked. Got endless apps with a friend. He got his and a refill before I even saw mine. Bartender asked me for a refill order before I even got my first one. Friend gets asked for order 3, still haven't gotten mine. So I order a round of drinks 3 friggin times. Let me just say this place stinks.

Worst meal ever! My friend and I ordered a Hendricks Cooler and a top shelf Long Island iced tea. When the drinks finally arrived, there was no descernable alcohol in either. The fried green beans took a while but were good. My friend ordered a cheeseburger with 2 wings on top. She requested it be well done so there was no pink. It came chard and hard but the cheese wasn't even melted. My sweet potato fries were cold. The worst of it was the waitress. She was oblivious and didn't appear at all concerned.  We had to hale her down because she never checked back to see if everything was good. Glad I had a coupon to cut off the tab. I have more coupons for later dates that I threw away. Won't be returning.

Worst experience ever!! I've worked in the industry for 12 years. I manage a restaurant. My sister manages a restaurant and I've even worked for This establishment when they first opened in milford. Everything about our lunch was unacceptable. It took forever for someone to even come to our table, once they did they didn't even introduce themselves when she came to our table. We ordered our drinks and apps. Again the drinks probably took a good 15 minutes to come and only 4 out of the six came. Our apps took forever as well, by time they we needed new drinks which the manager ended up getting because the waitress was "in the weeds" according to him. If I wasn't in the industry I probably wouldn't have known what that even meant, and I find it hard to believe when there was 6 tables at max there with like 5 servers. The two tables near us were also complaining about  the time everything was taking and the service they were getting. When our apps finally came we didn't even get share plates with them, our server never came over to ask how anything was, and when our food finally came 45 minutes later not all of the food came. One of our kids food wasn't ready yet. We waited and waited for the food, we could see in the kitchen and see it sitting there while our server just stood near the computers. She finally noticed is looking, went to get it and it was absolutely disgusting. The potatoes had blood in them, Donny nephew refused to eat them, and the steak was inedible. Again no one came over to ask if we needed anything else. By time the server did come my sister explained how horrible her food was and she came over with the check saying she took it off. When she came over we explained that my nephews food was also horrible, which she also took off. Finally she brought the bill, without asking anyone if they wanted dessert (which we probably wouldn't have ordered anyway because everything took forever), we gave her the cards and asked her to split them. When she returned we noticed she split the cards for more than what the bill was originally for. That was the last straw and completely unacceptable. We will never be back there!!

This is the first time in awhile that we've came here and they really went down hill in customer service. We got here around 5:30-6:00 and we ordered drinks and 2 appetizers, it took them at least an hour and a half to bring our drinks and food out. I am very disappointed and displeased. Don't think I'll come here again.

Went on Saturday night 4/16 and was told there would be a 15 minute wait. Wouldn't be a problem if there weren't 16 tables that were empty!  Unfortunately we were seated by the kitchen and I heard all the horror stories from the day. Raw burgers and chicken going out to customer's. Yet the staff didn't take it seriously and even joked about how many more would be going out incorrectly.  We were fortunate to have the staff and manager sit behind us and allow us to hear how they conduct themselves after hours. The manager needs to be more concerned with customer service being provided (or lack of) then being the employees best friend. Will never come back here again! I keep trying over and over again thinking it will get better and it never will!
Amongst food errors and slow service I received my burger with a long black hair in it.  Disgusting.

The place was empty but the bar was full. That should always put up a red flag. No one wants to eat there but plenty want to drink.  When I asked what beer they had on tap, the lady told me there was 10 different kinds, what kind do I like cause she didn't want to name off all ten.  Ordered the half rack of ribs and they were pathetic. Small with very little meat.

This was close to 4 stars. The waitress checked in regularly, although the kitchen disregarded the note about not putting onions in the quesadilla. The service from the kitchen wasn't bad but, it could have been a minute or two faster considering there were only 3 other tables or so and I came in by myself. Overall, the food was good, the drinks are good. I will definitely be back, maybe not soon but, I will dine here again.

We made the mistake of eating here Saturday night for a snack. Our appetizer came out after our soup and we had to wait for refills on our drinks. Our waitress was stressed and getting yelled at because of the poor service from other tables. The food was marginal, service less than and the restaurant seemed chaotic.

Sorry to do this really I am. This was always a staple when the kids were young and yes, it's a chain so expectations are kept in check. However, last Thursday went to lunch with my daughter. Arrived at 12:30 and it was dead! No problem, most likely a slow day. Waitress was so nice took our order and yes to my daughters chagrin I changed the cheese on my chicken sandwich ( that's worthy of an eye roll and a look that says, you are overcomplicating lunch... really)! Love it. Any way ordered their new southern fried chicken sandwich and my daughter ordered wings. Food took a while, perhaps longer that expected on a slow day with plenty of staff. Food arrives and I open my sandwich and turn it over to put some condiment on and it was charred beyond words! Not just a bit over fried, black!! It was served with fries and I had torn the bag just to see if they gave me the old fries when they redid my sandwich. 35 minutes later, my daughters lunch well over, back came sandwich 2... yup, same fries, ice cold. New sandwich, still burned which I attribute it to bad/old oil. They politely took it off the bill but guess what? Two managers circled my table yet not one said a word to me... not nice! I give our waitress so much credit but no we wont be back, and as a rewards member, I did not even take my card out.... I would have been saying thank you for an awful lunch. Sorry guys...

Just stopped by with my wife yesterday (June 20th, 2017) for a quick dinner. Once upon a time, TGIFs was a dependable, cutting edge chain of restaurants. That was a long time ago.  We waited 10 minutes to be seated (although the place was literally 90% empty). Our server was a nice 19 year old girl, but clearly was not at all well-trained by management. Despite her age, she served us wine (illegal?), and the food took f o r e v e r to come out.  Bottom line: Just a terrible experience top to bottom. I wouldn't be a bit surprised to find out that TGIFs is in bankruptcy -- that is how it felt. And all the while not a manager in sight.  Avoid at all costs.

Absolutely excellent service and top-notch food! Waitress was very attentive and polite and brought us things when we didn't even get the chance to ask for them because she had beat us to it LOL. This is definitely my favorite one!

I have been going to TGIF's all over the country since the 80's.   I always liked the consistency, trained personnel, friendly staff, and cleanliness.   Well the store at Milford is an anomaly. It smells like it is not clean,  the staff is poorly trained, I always have to ask for knife , fork, salt etc.  The food quality is  not good. If i did not have a huge number of points i would not go here.  The Applebees in town is far superior. Their staff is friendly and trained, and it does not smell like it needs a serious cleaning.

The service was pretty bad. The gentleman at the bar took my order (to-go) and said it would be 15-20 minutes. 10 minutes later a well dressed businessman walked in and placed a to go order, the bar tender made sure to ask him if he wanted a drink while he was waiting (only asked me after because he saw me glaring at him). 35 minutes later, my food came out and it was so disappointing. I ordered the BBQ chicken salad. It didn't come with half the ingredients listed and they were so stingy about giving me anything other than romaine and a slab of chicken. Tastes so bad

Went to celebrate a turning of a page with family! The drinks were tasty, although I like them a bit stronger. The hamburgers were huge and fun , with chicken wings on top , etc! We had a couple of orders of Jack Daniels Chicken appetizers . Talk about tasty and finger lickin' Good !!!

The experience I had at this TGI Fridays is one I will never forget. But not for good reasons. The food took an hour after the order was placed. When we received our food ,   (finally),  half of it was cold. Dig in right?  One problem we had no silverware. To  our surprise not a single piece of silverware was placed on our table from the time we were seated. Which at this point was  going on an hour and a half.  The waitress was very lethargic, unfriendly, and unapologetic. She eavesdropped on our conservation, was a stickler regarding refills, and served watered down undrinkable strawberry lemonade. After a half and hour she told us , " Good news, you are third in line."  Is this the Olympics?  Broccoli cheddar soup had ZERO cheddar and  was cold with a film on the top,(clearly microwaved) how appetizing. Also I literally vomited up a TGI app sampler in an Eastern Bank parking lot off route 3.
